intro: Aegiphila densiflora, commonly known as the denseflowered aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, aromatic leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
